programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: The quiz in which contestants try to score as few points as possible by plumbing the depths of their general knowledge to come up with the answers no-one else could think of. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and co-host Richard Osman.

programme.title: BBC News at Six
programme.desc: The latest national and international news stories from the BBC News team, followed by weather.

programme.title: Regional News and Weather
programme.desc: The latest news, sport and weather.

programme.title: Children in Need 2022
programme.desc: Live from Media City UK in Salford, Ade Adepitan, Mel Giedroyc, Chris Ramsey, Alex Scott and Jason Manford present BBC Children in Need. From Blankety Blank to The Repair Shop and Graham Norton’s Red Chair, the annual fundraiser will be jam-packed with exclusive sketches, exciting performances, music, dance and a few big surprises! As ever, this brilliant spectacle aims to raise vital money for children and young people across the UK who need help now more than ever.

programme.title: BBC News and Weather
programme.desc: The latest national and international news, with reports from BBC correspondents worldwide.

programme.title: Regional News and Weather
programme.desc: The latest news, sport and weather.

programme.title: Peter Kay's Stand-Up Comedy Shuffle
programme.desc: Join one of Bolton’s funniest stand-up comedians for his finest moments from the last 25 years.

programme.title: RuPaul's Drag Race UK
programme.desc: RuPaul’s search for the UK’s Next Drag Race Superstar has reached the semi-final. The remaining queens must take to the mic, writing their own material for a stand-up comedy challenge that sees them hit the campaign trail to secure a place in the grand finale. Comedy star Aisling Bea pops by to offer the queens stand-up tips, while actor and pop star Olly Alexander joins RuPaul as his extra special guest judge, alongside Michelle Visage and Alan Carr, as another queen is asked to sashay away.

programme.title: Blankety Blank
programme.desc: The legendary Blankety Blank is back! Bradley Walsh hosts as a panel of six celebrities try to fill in the missing blanks and help win some brilliant prizes for some very lucky contestants. This week he’s joined by Konnie Huq, Sara Davies, Bruno Tonioli, Jo Brand, Jamie Laing and Natalie Cassidy.

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: Clive Myrie asks the questions as four more famous faces brave the black chair in another episode of the classic quiz where celebrities donate to charity. BBC News correspondent Emma Vardy, Cheryl Baker from the pop group Bucks Fizz, actor Nikesh Patel and comedian David O’Doherty go under the spotlight tonight answering questions on the history of surfing, classic Disney films, Scrubs and the Tour de France in the 20th century.

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: Detailed weather forecast.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: BBC One joins the BBC's rolling news channel for a night of news.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: The latest news, sport, business and weather from the BBC's Breakfast team.

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt and chefs Tom Parker Bowles and Mandy Yin are joined by special guest Martin Kemp. There are great moments from the BBC food archive, including clips from Rick Stein, Marcus Wareing, Nigella Lawson and Keith Floyd, and drinks expert Olly Smith picks the wines to go with the studio dishes.

programme.title: Strawbridge over the Drawbridge
programme.desc: Chef James Strawbridge visits Greyabbey House, hoping to create a menu which captures the history and character of the estate and impresses its owners, Bill and Daphne Montgomery. After arriving by a rather unusual method of transport, James is taken on a tour of Bill and Daphne’s magnificent home. James discovers how the Montgomery family's acquisition of Greyabbey is all down to a large piece of cheese and hears the tale of Bill’s unfortunate relative who met a dastardly death at the hands of a pirate. At the coast nearby, James uncovers how a slippery sea substance was once a major source of income for local workers and landowners, before getting a taste of the stuff harvested fresh from the water. It isn’t all play and no work for James though. After learning everything he can about Greyabbey’s past, he has to create a meal which both captures the estate’s history and impresses the people who know more about the house than anyone else – its owners.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Today Natasha Raskin Sharp and the team are in Newbury. The reds and blues will be hitting the Newbury antiques fair today with experts Raj Bisram and Nick Hall. As usual, the reds and blues have 60 minutes in which to buy three items to send to auction.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: Rugby League World Cup Women's Final: Australia v New Zealand
programme.desc: Tanya Arnold introduces the climax of the women’s tournament as the finalists face off in the World Cup final at Old Trafford in Manchester.

programme.desc: Mark Chapman introduces live coverage of the men's final.

Tonight's celebrities are Dermot O’Leary on fish, Nicola Adams on boxing, Alexander Armstrong on classical music, Denise Van Outen on the 1990s, Olly Smith on wine, Gloria Hunniford on Hollywood icons and Rhys Stephenson on children's TV.

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing: Blackpool Special
programme.desc: After a two-year absence, Strictly Come Dancing returns to the iconic Blackpool Tower Ballroom. The show opens with an incredible routine celebrating all things Blackpool from our judges and professional dancers before our remaining couples take to the most famous sprung floor in the country. Who will steal the limelight?

programme.title: Blankety Blank
programme.desc: The legendary Blankety Blank is back! programme.title: Messi
programme.desc: Ahead of what is expected to be his World Cup farewell, this wide-reaching documentary seeks to provide a detailed understanding of the real Lionel Messi.

programme.title: MOTD World Cup Top 10: Stars of 2022
programme.desc: On the eve of football’s showpiece event in Qatar, Gary Lineker, Micah Richards and Alan Shearer select the ten players they predict will illuminate the tournament.

programme.title: DIY SOS: The Big Build for Children in Need
programme.desc: In this Children in Need Special, the DIY SOS team joins forces with Radio 2. Their mission is to transform a derelict site into a safe base for a young women’s charity in Leeds.

programme.title: Politics England
programme.desc: The latest political news, interviews and debate.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A huge 1930s house in Kidderminster in Worcestershire and a purpose-built flat in a 1980s block in Wembley in North London are sold at auction. Dion and Martel hear what the developers want to do with their investments, but not everything goes to plan.

programme.title: Children in Need 2022 Best Bits
programme.desc: Alex Scott and Chris Ramsey introduce highlights of the annual night of fundraising for Children in Need projects across the UK. Expect incredible music performances, inspiring stories, brand new comedy sketches and entertainment from some of the BBC’s biggest shows - including specials from The Repair Shop, Graham Norton’s Red Chair, Blankety Blank and the return of the Children in Need choir. Also, some of the UK’s biggest stars do a shift in a call centre like no other! Donations can still be made by visiting bbc.co.uk/pudsey, by calling 03457 33 22 33 or by text. To give £5, £10, £20 £30, or £40, simply text FIVE, TEN, TWENTY, THIRTY or FORTY to 70701.

programme.title: Songs of Praise: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: The Rev Kate Bottley is at Worcester Cathedral, celebrating the blessings pets bring to our lives, and Gemma Hunt learns how a church protects bats whilst still welcoming worshippers.

programme.title: MOTD Live: Women's Super League: Chelsea v Tottenham Hotspur
programme.desc: Alex Scott introduces the action from Kingsmeadow as reigning champions Chelsea take on London rivals Tottenham.

programme.title: MOTD Live: Qatar v Ecuador
programme.desc: Gary Lineker introduces live coverage of the opening game of this year’s World Cup, with hosts Qatar taking on Ecuador in the first of 64 matches over the next month. Commentary is by Steve Bower and Dion Dublin.

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: As Countryfile's Plant Britain initiative to plant three-quarters of a million trees across the UK reaches its climax, John Craven and Ellie Harrison are at the Countryfile wood in Cheshire. Planting here began just two years ago, but John and Ellie discover how the saplings are already helping nature. Ellie also checks out the positive impact trees have on the planet, from seed to deadwood. Charlotte Smith finds out how community gardens are changing lives and discovers the fascinating underground system that enables trees to talk to each other. Tom Heap visits the high-security government labs working to protect trees from climate change and disease. And finally, after two years of Countryfile viewers so magnificently pulling together, John and Ellie reveal an exciting update.

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing: The Results
programme.desc: It’s back to the Tower for the results show. Our professional dancers show us what Blackpool has meant to them in their poignant opening routine, and the brilliant Sam Ryder performs in the ballroom. At this stage of the competition, no-one wants to go home. Who will the judges save for another week?

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Chris and Freddie check out a new hot hatch from Honda and an old hot hatch from Peugeot. Paddy, meanwhile, takes on his toughest challenge to date: getting a team of young amateur racers up to professional motorsport standard in just two months.

programme.title: SAS Rogue Heroes
programme.desc: As the SAS's reputation spreads among the Axis Italian and German forces, another daring mission results in a shocking and devastating loss to the team.

programme.title: The Women's Football Show
programme.desc: Highlights from the Barclays Women's Super League as Arsenal host Manchester United, Tottenham travel to Chelsea, and Everton welcome Manchester City. The other fixtures are Aston Villa v Reading, Brighton v Liverpool and West Ham v Leicester.

programme.title: MOTD World Cup Top 10: Moments of the 2018 World Cup
programme.desc: Gary Lineker, Alan Shearer and Micah Richards discuss their standout memories from the World Cup in Russia four years ago.

programme.title: Late Night Football Club
programme.desc: Robbie Savage hosts a World Cup party for Wales alongside Jonny Owen and Polly James. Featuring star names from the worlds of sport, showbiz and music, this fun-packed studio show captures the mood of a nation as the national team prepare to face the USA in their first World Cup campaign in a generation. Coming from the heart of Welsh football, Wrexham, Late Night Football club is the place to celebrate this historic event.

programme.desc: Kym Marsh and Gethin Jones present a mix of topical chat and expert advice.

programme.title: Expert Witness
programme.desc: A fibre analyst helps convict the killer of grandmother Maureen Cosgrove, and how forensic evidence was used in the case of serial child killer Robert Black 40 years ago.

programme.title: Expert Witness
programme.desc: An expert witness uses soil analysis to find the body of a missing woman feared murdered, and a cell site expert uses his tracking skills to catch a killer in Northern Ireland.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin and Martel follow progress on a bungalow in Cabus in Lancashire and a three-storey house in Newport in Wales.

programme.title: MOTD Live: England v Iran
programme.desc: Gary Lineker introduces live coverage of England’s opening World Cup game against Group B rivals Iran at Doha’s Khalifa International Stadium. Commentary is by Guy Mowbray and Jermaine Jenas.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: With their entire belongings in two rucksacks, today’s couple have spent the last six years travelling the globe. With £325,000 the pair have decided they need a base in the Wiltshire countryside, and Alistair Appleton is the man to show them what this gorgeous county has to offer. Alistair also meets an intensive care nurse at her much loved and fruitful allotment.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team restore a vintage nursing chair, a helmet belonging to a firefighter involved in the Aberfan disaster and a traditional Italian coffee grinder.

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: The quiz in which contestants try to score as few points as possible by plumbing the depths of their general knowledge to come up with the answers no-one else could think of. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and co-host Richard Osman.

programme.desc: The latest news, sport and weather.

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp with the stories that matter from across the country.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Janine’s jibes at Linda continue. Billy struggles to hold things together and confides in Freddie. Rocky drops everything for a friend in need.

programme.title: Cost of Living: Can’t Afford My Home - Panorama
programme.desc: What does the winter hold for people struggling to get a home, or hold on to the one they already have? The rapid increase in interest rates has left many at breaking point. With mortgage rates up and rents soaring, Panorama spends time with those trying to survive, from young workers who've given up on ever owning a home of their own, to families facing eviction before Christmas. Reporter Richard Bilton investigates what's gone wrong with the UK's housing market.

programme.title: Cold Swim - We Are England
programme.desc: Retired north east cop Jacqui is just one of the millions of people across the UK who have taken up cold water swimming. After 30 years of service, she has had to deal with horrific crimes involving children and vulnerable adults, and she says swimming in the icy sea has done wonders for her mental and physical wellbeing. Always eager to help others, Jacqui has persuaded Kirk, a recovering alcoholic, and Sarah-Jane, who is in remission from a rare type of leukaemia, to take the cold water challenge.

programme.title: The Pact
programme.desc: When a police investigation begins into Connor’s disappearance, Christine must pull off her most masterful show of lies yet. Worried that Kate could become a liability, Christine pays her a visit, and the Rees siblings come to blows when Jamie makes a rash decision. Meanwhile, Megan’s new husband Gethin and Will’s wife Samantha grow tired of their partners’ lies.

programme.title: BBC News and Weather
programme.desc: The latest national and international news, with reports from BBC correspondents worldwide.

programme.title: Regional News and Weather
programme.desc: The latest news, sport and weather.

programme.title: MOTD: FIFA World Cup Highlights
programme.desc: Gabby Logan introduces highlights of the day's three matches: England v Iran, Senegal v Netherlands and USA v Wales.

programme.title: The English
programme.desc: In the Powder River region of Wyoming, cattle baron and English gentleman Thomas Trafford, despite being the first European to enter the region, is struggling to maintain his empire against the homesteader 'invasion'. He is alerted to a huge and mysterious loss: the horrific slaughter of all his pregnant cattle, for which he holds the homesteaders responsible. Meanwhile, on their journey north, Eli and Cornelia encounter a victim of Captain Clegg’s bushwhackers and an orphaned baby.

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Stephen Mangan is guest host with comedians Ria Lina and Ross Noble joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop as they delve into the news.

programme.desc: Jeanette Kwakye and Gethin Jones present a mix of topical chat and expert advice.

programme.title: Expert Witness
programme.desc: When a young nurse disappears, a soil analyst helps find her body and solve the crime. A digital imaging expert proves that what was thought to be an accidental death was murder.

programme.title: Dom Does America
programme.desc: Dom comes face to face with the American criminal justice system, working as a correctional officer in Randall County jail. His mentor, Officer William Huff, is an army veteran who served for a decade in the US Army and completed three tours of Iraq. Thrown in at the deep end, with male and female prisoners, in minimum- and maximum-security wings, can Dom make the grade in one of America’s most stressful and hazardous occupations?

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: In Maltby, near Rotherham, clever budgeting helps a woman transform a house in a poor state into her forever home, while developers, also with tight budgets, work wonders on their auction buys in Dunscroft, near Doncaster, and Havercroft, near Wakefield.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross and the teams visit Ardingly Antiques Fair with experts Caroline Hawley and Tim Weeks. Charlie heads to nearby Amberley Museum to learn about the history of firefighting in Britain.

programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Gareth makes a big decision, Valerie makes amends, and Sid examines a teenager’s mysterious stomach pains.

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Tensions run high between Daniel and Izzie. An anxious university student struggles to balance his double life of being both the boyfriend of an activist and the son of a corrupt politician.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: An adventurous young couple from Nottinghamshire are looking to move county and country to Argyll and Bute, where Sonali Shah has some splendid Scottish properties waiting to show them. In an action-packed few days, Sonali also takes to the water on a paddleboard and to the air in a seaplane, delighting at the spectacular views on offer from above.

programme.title: MOTD Live: Mexico v Poland
programme.desc: Gabby Logan introduces coverage of the Group C clash between Mexico and Poland, live from Stadium 974 in Doha. Commentary is by Pien Meulensteen and Martin Keown.

programme.title: MOTD Live: France v Australia
programme.desc: Gary Lineker introduces live coverage as reigning champions France begin the defence of their crown by taking on Group C rivals Australia at Qatar’s Al Janoub Stadium. Commentary is by Jonathan Pearce and Danny Murphy.

programme.title: Tokyo Vice
programme.desc: Young journalist Jake Adelstein, determined to make it in Tokyo, becomes the first foreigner to be hired by Tokyo newspaper Meicho Shimbun. Assigned to the crime desk and tasked with covering a stabbing, Jake becomes convinced the case is connected to something much bigger, but he discovers that, in Tokyo, journalists don't ask too many questions - if they know what's good for them. In English and Japanese with English subtitles.

programme.title: Tokyo Vice
programme.desc: Jake finally gets a piece published, but the celebrations don't last long as he learns that, in Tokyo, nothing comes for free. Local yakuza organisation Chihara-Kai, led by the formidable Ishida, is having its territory encroached on and being goaded by Tozawa's organisation. In English and Japanese with English subtitles.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Chris and Freddie check out a new hot hatch from Honda and an old hot hatch from Peugeot. Paddy, meanwhile, takes on his toughest challenge to date: getting a team of young amateur racers up to professional motorsport standard in just two months.

programme.desc: Sam Quek and Gethin Jones present a mix of topical chat and expert advice.

programme.title: Expert Witness
programme.desc: An expert in microscopic lifeforms helps solve the murder of a teenager, and a handwriting expert assists an old lady whose house has been sold without consent.

programme.title: Dom Does America
programme.desc: Dom takes on his toughest challenge yet, working as a paramedic in Austin, Texas. His mentor is clinical specialist Cassi Lydon, a veteran paramedic with 14 years’ service under her belt. Despite Dom’s aversion to blood, guts and gore, they face non-stop life-and-death emergencies over a 24-hour shift, pushing him to the limit both mentally and physically. Can he hack it at the coalface of America’s emergency medical care?

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: We head back to the Norfolk village of Hilgay, where Tommy first saw a characterful semi-detached cottage with very low ceilings back at the beginning of 2022. He’s also in Southampton to see a two-bed end-terrace. Dion is in Stoke-on-Trent to see a three-bed semi in need of a layout change downstairs.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp and the teams shop for antiques in the market town of Builth Wells, with experts Ben Cooper and Kate Bliss on hand to help them sniff out the best bargains. While the teams are busy shopping, Natasha quizzes fairgoers about a mystery item.

programme.title: BBC News at One
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: Regional News and Weather
programme.desc: The latest news, sport and weather.

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Scarlett gets herself into a spot of bother, while Cassidy sees an opportunity. Al gets entangled with two patients who are protesting against the removal of local benches.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore is at Witley recycling centre on a mission to stop three unwanted items being crushed. She intercepts a collection of hessian sacks, four dining chairs and some wooden drawers and a rug. With the help of bag-maker Rosanna Gethin and upholsterer Ollie Clueit, Sarah hopes to give new life to the old items, but will she harvest any profits by selling them on?

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Denise Nurse is in the coastal county of Cornwall today, helping a couple to turn their favourite holiday destination into their permanent home on a budget of £475,000. Away from the search, Denise visits a new development that’s tackling the county’s housing crisis by prioritising the needs of local Cornish people.

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: In Royal Wootton Bassett, Nicky, a hardworking single mum of four teenagers, needs Charlie and the Rich brothers to ride to the rescue of her garden. It's got tired turf, an ugly concrete path and no patio or decking to sit out on. But it does have one thing Nicky loves - her gnome collection! Nicky wants the garden to be somewhere fun, practical, social and easy to maintain, where the kids aren't embarrassed to bring friends and the gnomes can be proudly on display.

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers welcomes three more sellers to the Bidding Room, where they try to sell items to professional dealers who are on the lookout for interesting pieces, with help from expert Simon Bower. James from Stoke-on-Trent has brought in a pair of perplexing family possessions. Simon works out they are Victorian horse-hair singers, but will the dealers? Alice from Wales is selling an unusual item: a moulded model advert for men’s underwear from the early 20th century. And Kathy from Leicester wants to sell a catalogue of items from an auction organised to help the families of victims of the Titanic disaster. Titanic-related memorabilia usually sells well, and with such a poignant and touching story behind this particular item, can Kathy appeal to the dealers’ hearts and convince them to pay the price she’s hoping for? Today's dealers are Adi, James, JB, Lucy and Tash. Will any of them match, or even top, the valuation placed on each of the items?

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: The quiz in which contestants try to score as few points as possible by plumbing the depths of their general knowledge to come up with the answers no-one else could think of. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and co-host Richard Osman.

programme.desc: The latest national and international news stories from the BBC News team, followed by weather.

programme.desc: The latest news, sport and weather.

programme.title: MOTD Live: Belgium v Canada
programme.desc: Gary Lineker introduces live coverage as Canada contest their first World Cup game for 36 years, taking on a talented Belgian side who finished third at the 2018 tournament. Commentary is by Steve Wilson and Jermaine Jenas.

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: In the penultimate heat, the chefs are challenged to prepare steamed sea bream with Asian-style broth and beetroot tortellini with a goat's cheese and walnut filling.

programme.title: BBC News and Weather
programme.desc: The latest national and international news, with reports from BBC correspondents worldwide.

programme.title: Regional News and Weather
programme.desc: The latest news, sport and weather.

programme.title: Louis Theroux Interviews... Katherine Ryan
programme.desc: Louis spends time with Canadian comedian, actor and writer Katherine Ryan. Since her arrival in the UK 15 years ago, Katherine has become one of the country's most outspoken performers, and her career has grown from appearances on British panel shows to writing and executive producing her own television stand-up specials and performing in venues across the globe. Louis is invited to Katherine’s home for a frank, no-holds-barred conversation about her life and her comedy, including raising her daughter Violet as a single mum. Louis also accompanies Katherine as she performs her latest stand-up tour, Missus, in Southend-on-Sea, as well as a surprise set at a London comedy club. Louis also spends a rare day off with Katherine, Violet and Katherine's husband Bobby.

programme.title: Wreck
programme.desc: It's a big day on the ship - the captain's ball, attended by the VIP guests. Jamie shares an intimate moment with Olly, while Vivian cosies up to Lily, one of the guests, risking big repercussions if she's caught. Jamie and Vivian gather enough evidence to go to the authorities about Pippa's disappearance, but they just need the entertainment crew to back them up. As the captain's ball draws to a close, a crew member close to home is put in grave danger.

programme.title: Wreck
programme.desc: Jamie gains an unexpected ally on board, who promises to investigate Velorum from the inside and get the answers he's desperate for. Meanwhile, as Vivian and Lily grow closer, an unpleasant encounter forces Vivian to face lingering internal doubts. Armed with new information, Jamie and Vivian visit a new area of the ship and make a surprising discovery there - one that deepens the mystery of what happened to Pippa further.

programme.title: MOTD: FIFA World Cup Replay - Germany v Japan
programme.desc: A full replay of the game between Germany and Japan in Group E.

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: Detailed weather forecast.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: BBC One joins the BBC's rolling news channel for a night of news.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: The latest news, sport, business and weather from the BBC's Breakfast team.

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Sam Quek and Gethin Jones present a mix of topical chat and expert advice.

programme.title: Expert Witness
programme.desc: A blood spatter analyst unlocks the mystery of a woman murdered in her own car, and an expert witness uses a mobile phone to help detectives solve a baffling murder case.

programme.title: Dom Does America
programme.desc: Dom takes a break from the blue lights and sirens and really gets his hands dirty, working on a cattle ranch in Austin, Texas. His mentor is Josh Eilers, who served in the US military and completed four tours of Iraq and Afghanistan before founding Ranger Cattle nine years ago. Coming to terms with mud and dung, Dom puts his body on the line, tries not to break the farm machinery and faces one of his biggest fears – horses. Can he tough it out on the ranch with a modern-day cowboy?

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A three-bed semi in Kidsgrove in Stoke-on-Trent, a split-level maisonette in Brixton in London and a detached house in Leicester are sold at auction. All three projects involve a lot of work to create stunning family homes.

programme.title: BBC News at One
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: Regional News and Weather
programme.desc: The latest news, sport and weather.

programme.title: MOTD Live: Uruguay v Korea Republic
programme.desc: Gabby Logan introduces live coverage of the game between Uruguay and South Korea in Group H. Commentary is by Pien Meulensteen and Danny Murphy.

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: The pressure increases on Scarlett, Daniel has to meet Izzie’s new boyfriend, and Ruhma answers an SOS from a mum in her walking group.

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Arit Anderson and the Rich brothers are in Luton to create a garden with a holiday-at-home feel. Elizabeth and Benjamin Lovett and their children Thomas and Eleanor are a fun-loving family, but their garden is pretty drab. That's a shame, as during the summer the family say they practically live in it. The garden is particularly important to them because the family has numerous special needs which make going out very challenging. With a budget of £5,000, they have the money to make their dream garden come true. The question is which of the designers' gardens will match that dream?

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers hosts as members of the public with interesting items to sell meet five dealers who bid against each other to try and get themselves a bargain.

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: The quiz in which contestants try to score as few points as possible by plumbing the depths of their general knowledge to come up with the answers no-one else could think of. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and co-host Richard Osman.

programme.title: BBC News at Six
programme.desc: The latest national and international news stories from the BBC News team, followed by weather.

programme.title: Regional News and Weather
programme.desc: The latest news, sport and weather.

programme.title: MOTD Live: Brazil v Serbia
programme.desc: Gary Lineker introduces live coverage as Brazil begin their campaign to win a sixth World Cup with an opening match against Group G rivals Serbia. Commentary is by Guy Mowbray and Martin Keown.

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: It’s the final heat of MasterChef: The Professionals, and the last four hopefuls arrive in the kitchen eager to show they have what it takes in two challenges set by Anna, Marcus and Gregg. First up is the dreaded Skills Test. Marcus asks the first two chefs to prep a pigeon, cook it on the crown and serve the breasts with a pigeon and Madeira sauce. The other two contenders face Anna's test, to make a filo pastry mille feuille with layers of tropical fruit and piped coconut. Next, all four chefs have one last chance to demonstrate to judges their style, technical skill and culinary imagination in the Signature Menu challenge. In one hour and 30 minutes, the heat is on to cook two dishes of their own design that will wow Anna, Marcus and Gregg and show who deserves to stay in the competition. Only the two best chefs will return for the quarter-finals and forge ahead in their bid to be crowned MasterChef: The Professionals champion 2022.

programme.title: BBC News and Weather
programme.desc: The latest national and international news, with reports from BBC correspondents worldwide.

programme.title: Regional News and Weather
programme.desc: The latest news, sport and weather.

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents an hour of debate from Skipton in North Yorkshire. On the panel, from the government, TBC; Labour’s Andy Burnham, who is a former cabinet minister, and now mayor of Greater Manchester; Charlotte Ivers, political correspondent at Times Radio; the former Brexit MEP and businessman, Ben Habib; and the author, musician and social commentator Darren McGarvey.

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: Lighthearted discussion of the week's political events.

programme.title: What's Killing Our Rivers?
programme.desc: Rivers in Wales are dying, with sewage, slurry and other pollutants spewing in - but what is the cause, what is the real impact, and where are those whose job it is to protect our rivers? As the clock is ticking and battle lines are drawn, Wyre Davies investigates what and who is to blame.

programme.title: Late Night Football Club
programme.desc: Robbie Savage hosts a World Cup party for Wales, alongside Jonny Owen and Polly James. Featuring star names from the worlds of sport, showbiz and music, this fun packed studio show captures the mood of a nation as the national team prepare to face Iran in their latest World Cup clash. Coming from the heart of Wrexham, we look forward to this historic match and provide the best of the reaction to the group opener against the USA.

programme.title: MOTD: FIFA World Cup Replay - Portugal v Ghana
programme.desc: A full replay of the game between Portugal v Ghana in Group H.

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: Detailed weather forecast.

programme.desc: BBC One joins the BBC's rolling news channel for a night of news.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: The latest news, sport, business and weather from the BBC's Breakfast team.

programme.title: MOTD Live: Wales v Iran
programme.desc: Gabby Logan introduces live coverage as Wales continue their first World Cup campaign for 64 years, taking on Iran at the Ahmad Bin Ali Stadium in their second game in Group B. Commentary is by Steve Bower and Danny Gabbidon.

programme.title: BBC News at One
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: Regional News and Weather
programme.desc: The latest news, sport and weather.

programme.title: MOTD Live: Qatar v Senegal
programme.desc: Gary Lineker introduces live coverage as World Cup hosts Qatar continue their debut campaign against reigning African champions Senegal at Al Thumama Stadium. Commentary is by Jonathan Pearce and Dion Dublin.

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Daniel lets his personal concerns spill into work, Valerie has a nasty experience, and Sid has to deal with a patient who is on leave from the army.

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers hosts as five dealers bid against each other to buy items brought in by the public, including a mid-century sideboard, an antique comptometer and a retro arcade machine.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team bring three treasured family heirlooms, and the memories they hold, back to life. Metal maestro Dominic Chinea is blown away by a prewar ride-on toy aeroplane that has been grounded for decades. Owner Charlotte is hoping to restore her grandpa’s vintage toy for her own daughter Phoebe to enjoy. Rusty and in pieces, getting the plane fit for piloting again is going to be a mammoth job for Dom. Luthier Julyan Wallis is tasked with reviving a make-do-and-mend ukulele fashioned from an old cigar box. This hand-crafted instrument was made by owner Kate’s father in the 1920s and was played at family gatherings throughout her childhood. And ceramics expert Kirsten Ramsey works wonders on a collection of badly broken zoo animals made from wood pulp.

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: The quiz in which contestants try to score as few points as possible by plumbing the depths of their general knowledge to come up with the answers no-one else could think of. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and co-host Richard Osman.

programme.title: BBC News at Six
programme.desc: The latest national and international news stories from the BBC News team, followed by weather.

programme.title: Regional News and Weather
programme.desc: The latest news, sport and weather.

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Gethin Jones bring you the stories that matter from across the country.

programme.title: England's Greatest Showman - We Are England
programme.desc: Eighty-year-old Nipper is fairground aristocracy, the head of East Anglia’s largest family of showmen. We join them on the road, seeing the challenges they face.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: DI Mooney and the team enter the high-stakes world of poker when a finalist is poisoned during the Caribbean Poker Masters tournament. The only suspects are sat round the table. When even a twitch of an eye can reveal a player's hand, just how did the killer commit murder?

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: In the last quarter-final, the four best chefs from this week's heats come together to compete in two challenges set by judges Anna Haugh and Marcus Wareing. To earn the last two places in the semi-finals, the chefs must show off their creativity in an Invention Test, then prepare food for some of the UK's most hard to please food critics. Only the most exciting culinary talents will continue in the competition. In the first challenge, the judges set a pastry Invention Test with a twist: the dessert must be based on a savoury ingredient. Next to the classic pastry ingredients in the larder, the chefs have cheeses, bacon, vegetables, chillies and herbs to build their dishes around. Then, the chefs face one of the toughest rounds of the competition. In just one hour and 15 minutes, they must serve up an exceptional two-course meal to three of the country's biggest restaurant critics. This is their chance to shine as they cook for people who could one day make or break their careers.

programme.title: BBC News and Weather
programme.desc: The latest national and international news, with reports from BBC correspondents worldwide.

programme.title: Regional News and Weather
programme.desc: The latest news, sport and weather.

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Together on Graham’s sofa tonight: former James Bond Daniel Craig, now starring in Glass Onion: A Knives Out Mystery; Oscar-winner Emma Thompson, playing Miss Trunchbull in Roald Dahl's Matilda the Musical; BBC newsman and Mastermind presenter Clive Myrie; acting great Ian McKellen and top comic John Bishop, together in Mother Goose; and music from Charlie Puth, who performs his new single Loser. Plus more stories from the audience in the world-famous Big Red Chair.

programme.title: MOTD: FIFA World Cup Highlights
programme.desc: Mark Chapman introduces the best of the action from the day’s cross-Atlantic clash between England and the USA as both teams continued their attempts to reach the last 16. The day's other game in Group B saw Wales face Iran, and there were two Group A fixtures: Qatar v Senegal and the Netherlands v Ecuador.

programme.title: RuPaul's Drag Race UK
programme.desc: It’s the grand finale! The competition concludes in an all-singing, all-dancing extravaganza fight for the crown. Choreographer Claudimar Neto coaches the queens through their intense final challenge, while Michelle Visage, Alan Carr, Graham Norton and the eliminated queens return to witness RuPaul crown the UK’s next Drag Race superstar.

programme.desc: A full replay of the game between England and the USA in Group B.

programme.desc: Mark Chapman introduces live coverage as Tunisia take on Australia at the Al Janoub Stadium in the second round of matches in Group D. Commentary is by Vicki Sparks and Danny Murphy.

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities: BBC Centenary Special
programme.desc: A special BBC Centenary edition of the general knowledge quiz in which four teams try to come up with the answers that no-one else could think of. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and co-host Richard Osman, with contestants Tony Blackburn, Scott Mills, Dr Maggie Aderin-Pocock, Prof Chris Lintott, Peter Purves, Lindsey Russell, Shanequa Paris, Mobeen Ahzar and Baroness Floella Benjamin.

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's The Wheel
programme.desc: Sarah Millican, Lawrence Chaney, Ellie Simmonds, David Baddiel, MistaJam, Vanessa Feltz and Darren Harriott try to help three contestants win life-changing cash.

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing
programme.desc: Strictly Come Dancing is approaching the last leg of the competition, and our couples have to do more than ever to secure their places in next week’s Musicals Special quarter-final. For the judges, expectations are high, so it will be another weekend of fantastic ballroom dancing.

programme.title: I Can See Your Voice
programme.desc: Celebrity investigators Jimmy Carr, Alison Hammond and Amanda Holden try to help best friends Esslyne and Nkechi from Kent to tell the difference between good and bad mystery singers without ever hearing them sing a note. With £10,000 at stake, and a line-up including a yoga instructor, a ringmaster and a milkman, they attempt to weed out the bad singers based on a series of clues, interrogations and lip-sync performances. Special guest Claire Richards from Steps brings her pop knowledge to help spot the imposters, and all our stars take on one of Steps’ iconic dance routines.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Stevie’s exciting opportunity is jeopardised by a patient, while Jan is seriously affected by her workload.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest weather forecast.

programme.title: MOTD: FIFA World Cup Highlights
programme.desc: Gabby Logan rounds up a packed day of action at the 2022 World Cup, featuring the heavyweight contest between defending champions France and dynamic Denmark. France won the second of their world titles in Russia four years ago, while Denmark won the hearts of neutral fans during their brave performances at Euro 2020, reaching the semi-finals of the tournament despite the alarming collapse of midfielder Christian Eriksen in their opening game. You can also see highlights as two-time world champions Argentina took on Mexico, Robert Lewandowski’s Poland faced Saudi Arabia and Tunisia played Australia.

programme.title: MOTD World Cup Top 10: Greatest World Cup Players
programme.desc: Gary Lineker, Alan Shearer and Micah Richards debate the footballers who have made the biggest impact on the sport’s greatest stage during their lifetimes.

programme.title: End of Watch
programme.desc: Brian and Mike are two LAPD cops, partners at work and best friends outside it. Patrolling one of LA's toughest districts, they tackle everything from street violence to house fires, and they think they have seen it all. But when they stumble on something and pull off a massive drugs bust, they are entering into a world even they aren't prepared for.

programme.title: MOTD: FIFA World Cup Replay - France v Denmark
programme.desc: A full replay of the game between France and Denmark in Group D.

programme.title: Sunday with Laura Kuenssberg
programme.desc: Interviews with key politicians and public figures.

programme.title: Politics England
programme.desc: The latest political news, interviews and debate.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Two terraced houses in Abbeywood in London and Carlisle in Cumbria are transformed, and the team follow a seven-year project to renovate a large period house in Torquay. All the properties were bought at auction by developers hoping to make money through renovation, but did anyone manage to make a profit?

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Presenter Eric Knowles is in Peterborough for one of the largest antiques fairs in the UK. He's joined by Bargain Hunt regular Colin Young, who has some top tips for porcelain collectors. Experts Stephanie Connell and Philip Serrell guide the red and blue teams around the fair, but who will go home empty-handed and who is making a big score?

programme.title: Songs of Praise: Young Chorister of the Year
programme.desc: Aled Jones presents the boys' semi-final of BBC Young Chorister of the Year from Gorton Monastery in Manchester, with judges Katherine Jenkins, Howard Goodall and David Grant. Five of the best young choristers in the country sing a sacred song, and their choices include How Beautiful Are the Feet from Handel’s Messiah, Pie Jesu by Fauré, Lorenc’s Ave Maria, Panis Angelicus by Franck and the popular hymn set to Holst’s stirring music, I Vow To Thee, My Country. Three of the five boys will be selected to sing in the final on 11 December.

programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.desc: Mark Chapman introduces live coverage as Belgium, the number two side in the world rankings, continue their bid to win a maiden World Cup, taking on Group F rivals Morocco. Commentary is by Guy Mowbray and Jermaine Jenas.

programme.title: MOTD Live: Croatia v Canada
programme.desc: The second round of matches at the 2022 World Cup continues with the clash between 2018 runners-up Croatia and Canada, introduced by Gabby Logan. Commentary is by Steve Wilson and Martin Keown.

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing: The Results
programme.desc: Tonight’s results show opens with another fabulous routine from our professional dancers, and special guests Tom Grennan and Joel Corry perform in the ballroom. Our couples can do no more. How have your votes at home changed Saturday night’s leaderboard? With a place in next week’s Musicals Special quarter-final up for grabs, the dance-off is not to be missed. Who will the judges save, and who will be your 2022 quarter-finalists?

programme.title: MOTD Live: Spain v Germany
programme.desc: Gary Lineker introduces live coverage of the blockbuster Group E contest between 2010 world champions Spain and four-time winners Germany at the Al Bayt Stadium. Commentary is by Steve Bower.

programme.title: SAS Rogue Heroes
programme.desc: Paddy initiates the Free French soldiers into some unorthodox training methods, and Stirling leads a raid on Benghazi accompanied by the prime minister’s son, Randolph Churchill.

programme.title: MOTD: FA Cup Highlights
programme.desc: Highlights of all the games in the second round of the FA Cup.

programme.title: Gringo
programme.desc: On a business trip to Mexico, mild-mannered businessman Harold Soyinka finds himself at the mercy of his back-stabbing business colleagues back home, local drug lords and a morally conflicted black-ops mercenary. Crossing the line from law-abiding citizen to wanted criminal, Harold battles to survive his increasingly dangerous situation.

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Kym Marsh and Gethin Jones present a mix of topical chat and expert advice.

programme.title: Expert Witness
programme.desc: Police turn to a footprint analyst and a pollen expert to help solve a murder in Manchester, and a soil expert unearths the evidence needed to arrest a gang of treasure thieves.

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: Insurers combine forces to catch a serial fraudster making fake insurance claims off the back of high-profile tragedies, while an adrenaline junkie showing off on social media forgets that her antics can be seen by everyone, including those investigating her personal injury claim. Digital data embedded in photographs submitted to support a claim for £35,000 of stolen jewellery reveal that it’s a complete lie, and a cat owner grossly inflates a claim when she loses two of her moggies.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Properties in Sevenoaks in Kent, Beeston in Nottinghamshire and Dalston in London are sold under the hammer. The projects are varied and encounter unexpected twists, taking up to seven years to complete. Are the developers happy with the end results?

programme.title: BBC News at One
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: Regional News and Weather
programme.desc: The latest news, sport and weather.

programme.title: MOTD Live: Korea Republic v Ghana
programme.desc: Gabby Logan introduces live coverage as South Korea take on Group H rivals Ghana at Qatar’s Education City Stadium. Commentary is by Jonathan Pearce and Dion Dublin.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A south London couple have high hopes of escaping the rat race and finding their dream home in the High Weald with the help of Alistair Appleton. The pair have a hearty budget of £950,000 to find a property suitable for multiple generations of the family. Alistair also discovers an exotic side to the region when he visits a wildlife reserve in the Kent countryside.

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers hosts as five dealers bid to buy items brought in by the public, including an antique games table, a set of pristine pen nibs and some TV puppet heads.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team bring three treasured family heirlooms, and the memories they hold, back to life. Silversmith Brenton West takes on the repair of a salt and pepper music box of great sentimental value to owner Janice. The ornate pair was purchased in Hong Kong by Janice’s mother, who accompanied her father during his army posting in the 1950s. Janice played with the set throughout her childhood, and now she wants her daughter to treasure it for future generations. Mechanical expert Steve Fletcher finds himself flummoxed by a talking doll who’s lost her voice. Mending the miniature record player inside her proves an unusually tricky challenge for Steve. Meanwhile, teddy bear ladies Julie Tatchell and Amanda Middleditch take on the comparatively fun part of the fix, creating her original 1960s clothes. And master hatter Jayesh Vaghela is brought to the barn to tackle a treasured hat worn by a prisoner of war as he worked on the Death Railway in the Second World War.

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: The quiz in which contestants try to score as few points as possible by plumbing the depths of their general knowledge to come up with the answers no-one else could think of. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and co-host Richard Osman.

programme.title: BBC News at Six
programme.desc: The latest national and international news stories from the BBC News team, followed by weather.

programme.title: Regional News and Weather
programme.desc: The latest news, sport and weather.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Janine’s true colours show as she frets over Mick and Linda. Freddie hatches a plan to help Harvey, and Kat is less than impressed by Alfie’s latest confession.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Shirley sees through Janine’s lies, Rocky faces a difficult decision, and Nish questions Suki’s behaviour around Eve.

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Ten contenders compete in the semi-finals. They must create showstopping dishes based on their favourite food memories.

programme.title: The Pact
programme.desc: The walls are closing in on the Rees family now that Will is the prime suspect in the police investigation. Christine is desperately trying to hold it together. As Beth and Joe get closer to figuring out what happened at the wedding, Megan and Jamie are forced into a confession. In the midst of everything, Christine grapples with the reality of Kayla’s connection to her family and reveals a life-changing secret to the kids.

programme.title: BBC News and Weather
programme.desc: The latest national and international news, with reports from BBC correspondents worldwide.

programme.title: Regional News and Weather
programme.desc: The latest news, sport and weather.

programme.title: MOTD: FIFA World Cup Highlights
programme.desc: Mark Chapman introduces highlights of another hectic day of 2022 World Cup action, featuring Brazil taking on Switzerland, Portugal against Uruguay, Cameroon facing Serbia, and South Korea's game against Ghana.

programme.title: The English
programme.desc: In Powder River, Wyoming, Sheriff Marshall is investigating the mysterious murder/suicide an ex-cavalry soldier and his homesteader wife. Meanwhile, Eli waits for Cornelia's return on the Clarkes' farm but discovers a more sinister side to their business.

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is guest host with panellists journalist Mishal Husain and comedian Geoff Norcott joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop. Filmed on Thursday 14 October.

programme.title: Late Night Football Club
programme.desc: Robbie Savage hosts a World Cup party for Wales alongside Jonny Owen and Polly James. Featuring star names from the worlds of sport, showbiz and music, this fun-packed studio show captures the mood of a nation as the national team prepare to face England in their final group game. Coming from the heart of Welsh football, Wrexham, Late Night Football Club is the place to celebrate this historic event.

programme.title: MOTD: FIFA World Cup Replay - Brazil v Switzerland
programme.desc: A full replay of the match between Brazil and Switzerland in Group G.

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Sam Quek and Gethin Jones present a mix of topical chat and expert advice.

programme.title: Expert Witness
programme.desc: Blood spatter analysis helps identify the killer of a body found in a suitcase, and an expert helps in a serious case of financial fraud that cost some victims their life savings.

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: We go behind bars when a prison inmate claims he had a weightlifting accident in the gym, while there’s trouble in store for one supermarket when a group of women stage a fall. Forensic engineers are called in to establish what really happened in a collision between a scooter and a car, and when a Rolex gets ruined, the claimant has problems recalling his timings.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: It’s a tale of two detached bungalows for Tommy as he visits Mexborough in South Yorkshire and Orpington in London. Martel is in the village of Greengill in Cumbria to see a detached house set on several acres of rural land.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross and the teams try to uncover profitable antiques in Sussex with experts Caroline Hawley and Tim Weeks. While the reds and blues compete to make the most money at auction, Charlie learns how science can help to prove the authenticity of ancient artefacts, using a process called thermoluminescence.

programme.title: BBC News at One
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: Regional News and Weather
programme.desc: The latest news, sport and weather.

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: The net closes in on Scarlett, Valerie makes a big decision, and Bear runs a conflict resolution course that ends up more real than expected.

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Emma and Jimmi have to examine a possible rape victim and the accused. Meanwhile, the pressure rises on Scarlett.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A first-time buyer has decided to leave the home she grew up in on the outskirts of Birmingham for a new one in the nearby Shropshire countryside. Nicki Chapman shows her what this stunning county has to offer, and helps out by pulling pints for the locals at a community-owned pub.

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers welcomes three more sellers to the Bidding Room, where they try to sell items to professional dealers who are on the lookout for interesting pieces, with help from expert Simon Bower. First through the doors is Annalisa, with a unique piece of farming history. Will the dealers work out what it is? Also facing the dealers are mother and daughters Jennifer, Ann and Gina, with a fascinating tribal mask bought from their local school. Simon helps them work out where it came from before they face the dealers. Using their new knowledge, can they strike a good deal? Last to try her luck with our buyers is Chrissy, with a charming family heirloom: a toy horse and cart that she hopes will see her galloping off with a tidy profit. Today's dealers are Adi, Ian, James, Jane and Tash. Will any of them match - or even top - the valuation placed on each of the items?

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: The quiz in which contestants try to score as few points as possible by plumbing the depths of their general knowledge to come up with the answers no-one else could think of. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and co-host Richard Osman.

programme.title: BBC News at Six
programme.desc: The latest national and international news stories from the BBC News team, followed by weather.

programme.title: Regional News and Weather
programme.desc: The latest news, sport and weather.

programme.title: MOTD Live: Wales v England
programme.desc: Gary Lineker introduces live coverage of the huge Home Nations clash between Wales and England as the sides meet for the very first time at a World Cup. Commentary is by Guy Mowbray and Danny Gabbidon.

programme.title: The Traitors
programme.desc: Claudia Winkleman greets 22 strangers as they arrive at a beautiful castle in the Scottish Highlands to play the ultimate reality game of detection, backstabbing and trust, in the hope of winning up to £120,000. And it’s not long before the players are questioning everything, and everyone, as Claudia secretly assigns three traitors. It is up to the traitors, under the cover of darkness, to pick off their fellow players one by one, murdering them from the game. The rest of the players, the faithful, must try to work out who the traitors are and banish them from the game before they become their next victim. The lucky ones who survive to the end will have a chance to win that life-changing cash. But if a traitor remains undetected, they will take all the money.

programme.title: BBC News and Weather
programme.desc: The latest national and international news, with reports from BBC correspondents worldwide.

programme.title: Regional News and Weather
programme.desc: The latest news, sport and weather.

programme.title: Tokyo Vice
programme.desc: Jake proves himself to Detective Katagiri and learns a valuable lesson about the relationship between the police and the yakuza. Samantha reveals that she has much bigger and better plans than continuing to work for Duke. In English and Japanese with English subtitles.

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's The Wheel
programme.desc: Sarah Millican, Lawrence Chaney, Ellie Simmonds, David Baddiel, MistaJam, Vanessa Feltz and Darren Harriott try to help three contestants win life-changing cash.

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Together on Graham’s sofa tonight: former James Bond Daniel Craig, now starring in Glass Onion: A Knives Out Mystery; Oscar-winner Emma Thompson, playing Miss Trunchbull in Roald Dahl's Matilda the Musical; BBC newsman and Mastermind presenter Clive Myrie; acting great Ian McKellen and top comic John Bishop, together in Mother Goose; and music from Charlie Puth, who performs his new single Loser. Plus more stories from the audience in the world-famous Big Red Chair.

programme.title: MOTD: FIFA World Cup Replay - Wales v England
programme.desc: A full replay of the huge Home Nations clash between Wales and England.

programme.desc: Detailed weather forecast.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: BBC One joins the BBC's rolling news channel for a night of news.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: The latest news, sport, business and weather from the BBC's Breakfast team.

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Sam Quek and Gethin Jones present a mix of topical chat and expert advice.

programme.title: Expert Witness
programme.desc: An expert in mobile phone technology tracks the movements of a murder suspect, and an expert in art fraud determines whether a very expensive painting is genuine or fake.

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: Secret filming is the undoing of a con man who claims he can’t work due to an injury, while a cat lover comes a cropper attempting to make a claim when she wasn’t covered. Elderly drivers are ruthlessly targeted in a car park crash scam, a first-time buyer making a claim for a damaged television trips himself up with photos that prove he wasn’t insured, and in America a doctor abuses his position to make millions of dollars from medical health insurance fraud.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A terrace house in Stoke-on-Trent, a semi-detached house in Chaddesden in Derby and a five-apartment building in Chatham in Kent are all sold at auction. Martin, Dion and Jacqui meet the new owners and hear their plans to make money from their investments.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion and the teams hunt for profitable antiques in Nottinghamshire with experts Thomas Forrester and Ochuko Ojiri before heading to Derby for today’s auction. Christina discovers how traditional letterpress printing is making a comeback.

programme.title: BBC News at One
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: Regional News and Weather
programme.desc: The latest news, sport and weather.

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Emma and Jimmi have their police work appraisal, while Melissa deals with the consequences of her night out. DS Cassidy is desperate to get a conviction.

programme.title: Planet Earth: A Tale of Three Bears
programme.desc: Sam, Sophie and Sybil are three tiny black bear cubs who have just emerged from their den in the Northwoods of Minnesota. But this spectacular wilderness is full of threats - wolves and coyotes roam the forest looking for stray cubs, the weather can be dangerously unpredictable bringing blizzards and forest fires, and every year some of the black bears are killed by humans. Their survival depends entirely on the experience of their mother and how well they learn the skills she teaches them. With the help of bear expert Dr Lynn Rogers, Julia Bradbury explores the woods, learning about the lives of the black bears and the particular trials facing these three vulnerable little cubs. Sam, Sophie and Sybil must follow their mother's lead closely if they are going to survive in this tough and unforgiving wilderness and make it through this critical month.

programme.title: MOTD Live: Tunisia v France
programme.desc: Gabby Logan introduces live coverage as defending champions France take on Group C rivals Tunisia at the Education City Stadium in Qatar. Commentary is by Robyn Cowen and Martin Keown.

programme.title: MOTD Live: Poland v Argentina
programme.desc: Gary Lineker introduces live coverage of the Group C clash between Poland and Argentina from Stadium 974 in Doha. Commentary is by Steve Bower and Danny Murphy.

programme.title: The Traitors
programme.desc: The ultimate game of detection, backstabbing and trust suddenly becomes very real for the players as it’s revealed who has been murdered during the night by the traitors. As accusations start to fly, the group are sent on another mission to continue building money for the prize pot. Evening starts to descend, and attention turns back to whom the traitors could be. The players head to the round table for the first dramatic banishment, but will the faithful be able to catch a traitor, or will they unknowingly banish one of their own?

programme.desc: Louis Theroux meets global popstar Rita Ora for a revealing conversation about her musical career, dealing with press scrutiny and her family’s arrival in the UK as refugees.

programme.title: Wreck
programme.desc: Jamie becomes a fugitive onboard, forcing his friends to hatch a daring plan, one that leads to Jamie discovering the truth about what is really happening onboard.

programme.title: Wreck
programme.desc: Jamie finds himself in a lethal dead end with seemingly no way out. But after a surprise intervention brings some momentary respite, he learns that others are in peril.

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones presents a mix of topical chat and expert advice.

programme.title: Expert Witness
programme.desc: Bite marks convict a killer, and an autograph expert helps stop a lucrative scam.

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: A bishop faces judgement when he unsuccessfully tries to pull off a £12,000 car scam, while a woman’s personal injury claim bites back after she claims that metal shards were found in her takeaway. A dog owner can’t seem to remember when a brand new puppy was seriously injured, dash-cam footage exposes a bogus accident, and insurers box clever when social media catches a fraudster out.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Jacqui heads to Lowestoft in Suffolk to see a one-bed flat that’s just a stone’s throw from the beach. Dion’s in the South Yorkshire town of Mexborough to visit a two-bed terrace in need of a full refurbishment. Tommy visits Whittlesey in Cambridgeshire to cast his eye over a three-bedroom detached house that is seriously lacking in kerb appeal.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Danny Sebastian heads to Harrogate, where experts Izzie Balmer and John Cameron help the teams identify profitable antiques before heading to Beverley Racecourse for today’s auction. Danny learns all about the Recycling Project.

programme.title: BBC News at One
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: Regional News and Weather
programme.desc: The latest news, sport and weather.

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Princess’s attitude doesn’t go unnoticed, while Cassidy has some important news for Mel. Jimmi finds that everything is not always as it seems when he bumps into a counselling patient having a crisis.

programme.title: Planet Earth: A Lion's Tale
programme.desc: Moja is a five-month-old lion cub living with his single lioness mum, Nyota, in Kenya's Masai Mara. It is May, and food is scarce; Moja is starving. The rains have arrived, and prey is thin on the ground. Without the help and protection of a pride, Moja faces the toughest month of his life. Moja's mum, Nyota, is his only hope. She must find enough food to keep them both alive and protect Moja from the hyenas and lions that surround them. Together, they face a fight for life; this is their story.

programme.title: MOTD Live: Croatia v Belgium
programme.desc: Group F concludes with a blockbuster clash as 2018 runners-up Croatia take on Belgium, who finished third four years ago in Russia. Gary Lineker introduces the action, with commentary by Steve Bower and Jermaine Jenas.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Sonia attempts to get through to Janine, worried she’s losing control. One resident faces the consequences of their actions, and despite his situation, Alfie steps up for Tommy.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Janine remains determined to cement herself into Mick’s life. Upsetting news reaches the square, and Denise steps in to help Jack support Amy.

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Four semi-finalists cook in a pop-up restaurant environment for 20 of the UK's top food entrepreneurs.

programme.title: The Traitors
programme.desc: There are tears and anger over the breakfast table as the identity of the second person to be murdered by the traitors is revealed. The players are sent into a spin as they discover more about each other in the mission, and a dramatic showdown at the round table results in another player being banished from the game. As evening descends and the players reel from yet another day of treachery, Claudia has one more surprise twist up her sleeve.

programme.desc: Mark Chapman introduces highlights from the final matches from Group E at the World Cup in Qatar, with Spain and Germany both in action. Four-time winners Germany took on Costa Rica, while 2010 champions Spain were in action against Japan. In Group F, Croatia met Belgium, and Canada faced Morocco.

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: Lighthearted discussion of the week's political events.

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Kimberley Walsh and Gethin Jones present a mix of topical chat and expert advice.

programme.title: Expert Witness
programme.desc: When a man kills four people and goes on the run, a handwriting analyst is brought in, and after a body is found, an expert in pollen links the suspects to the scene of the crime.

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: When a bus and a bin lorry collide there are claims for severe whiplash, but will the bus company trash them? Burning questions are asked when a year after a house fire a second claim comes in, the data embedded in digital photographs submitted to support stolen items doesn’t add up, and investigators use the same black box technology you would find in an aeroplane to foil a fake motor insurance claim.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: It's a family affair for a trio of terraces in Pendeford in Wolverhampton, Gorleston-on-Sea in Great Yarmouth and Crewe in Cheshire. Martin, Tommy and Jacqui follow progress as three different families tackle their renovations.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: In Guildford, Eric Knowles and the teams shop for profitable antiques with experts Raj Bisram and Stephanie Connell to sell at auction in Portsmouth. Meanwhile, Eric hops aboard HMS Victory to learn more about the renovation of the world’s oldest commissioned warship.

programme.title: BBC News at One
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: Regional News and Weather
programme.desc: The latest news, sport and weather.

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Mel’s actions send shockwaves throughout the station, Princess waits for an important call, and Valerie gets some big news. Scarlett finds herself caught in the middle when a celebrity rapper and his girlfriend are sent to do community payback outside the campus surgery.

programme.title: Planet Earth: A Monkey's Tale
programme.desc: Gremlin is a nine-week-old baby toque macaque. She was born into a troop of 70 monkeys who live amongst spectacular ruined temples in northern Sri Lanka. Despite the beautiful location, life is going to be a challenge for this little monkey. There are harsh internal politics to negotiate and predators roaming the forest floor. But the biggest threat to her survival comes from a rival troop of monkeys known as the Slumdogs. They are led by a big male called Bad-Eye and the vicious rivalry over territory between the two families threatens to explode at any moment. One in three macaques do not reach their first birthday, and if spirited little Gremlin is going to be one of the lucky ones she will need to learn the lessons of survival fast.

programme.title: MOTD Live: Korea Republic v Portugal
programme.desc: Gary Lineker introduces live coverage as Cristiano Ronaldo’s Portugal play their last match of Group G against a South Korea side that boasts Son Heung-min in their ranks. Commentary is by Vicki Sparks and Danny Murphy.
